description: A traditional technique used in desert regions to harvest rainwater, allowing moisture to seep into the soil and recharge groundwater, supporting crop cultivation in dry climates without the need for pumps.
principles: Support for agriculture in arid climates
steps: Identify suitable land slopes for rainwater harvesting.
Construct barriers or channels to direct rainwater.
Allow water to spread across agricultural land.
Monitor soil moisture levels to ensure effectiveness.
risks: Erosion of soil if not properly managed
Potential for waterlogging in poorly designed systems
